content: bitsa bootees 3 sizes newborn to 9 months © 2024 rian anderson made flat from the sole up these booties can be made from small bits of stash yarn as long as they are about the same thickness samples used 8 ply scraps but 4 ply used double or worsted can also work providing the gauge gauge is met the construction is unusual and is all garter stitch no purling bitsa bootees 1 size 1 2 3 to fit ages guide only 0 - 3 mths 3 - 6 mths 6 - 9 mths measurements in cms/inches approx sole of foot 7 / 2 75 8 / 3 9 / 3 5 materials in ms/yds in 8 ply 50gm = 100m/110yds approx depends on yarns used 45 / 50 50 / 55 55 / 60 gauge / gauge k2tog = knit 2 sts together 21sts to 10 cm in garter stitch with chosen dk / 8 pm = place marker on right needle ply yarn on 3 75 mm us 5 needles or needles to sm = slip marker from left to right needle get gauge repeat = repeat rs = right side ws = wrong side basic requirements k2tog k1 x 2 eg = instructions inside 1 pair 3 75 mm us 5 needles or size to get brackets to be repeated the number of times after x gauge therefore this example = k2tog k1 k2tog k1 plus a spare needle 4 5mm us 7 or 2 sizes larger three needle cast off hold needles alongside than main needles each other in left hand with wrong sides of work tapestry needle facing outwards with a larger needle in right hand 4 stitch markers cast off sts by knitting 2 sts together one from each optional - 3 5 / 4 mm crochet hook needle repeat and cast off a st knit 2 sts together one from each needle and cast off a st continue abbreviations read before starting like this till all sts are cast off work break off yarn and pull through last st k = knit pick up and knit = with right side of work facing p = purl place right needle into the front of the loop at the st = stitch edge of the work and pull a st through as if knitting m = marker continue till required number of stitches are on right pm = place marker on right needle needle sm = slip marker from left to right needle there are alternate knots and strands at the row repeat = repeat edges to get the correct number of stitches you rs = right side will need to pick up 3 sts from every 4 row so pick ws = wrong side up by knitting into a knot at the end of a ridge a cast on cable method = after making 2 sts strand and a knot and missing the next strand place right needle between last 2 sts to pull
